info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:59PM CDT until June 10 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR JACKSON...SOUTHWESTERN KIOWA...HARMON...GREER...NORTHWESTERN WILBARGER AND HARDEMAN COUNTIES... At 1159 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Martha to 3 miles northwest of Quanah, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...The Gould Mesonet measured a 62 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Altus, Mangum, Quanah, Hollis, Granite, Blair, Chillicothe, Olustee, Eldorado, Martha, Gould, Elmer, Friendship, Altus Air Force Base, Vinson, Warren, Medicine Mound, Humphreys, Odell and Duke. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
